1 /**
  2  * @fileoverview
  3  * - Depends only on console.*
  4  * - modern browser MUST be supported. other may be supported
  5  * - TODO is the namespace name properly named
  6  *
  7  * Is it possible to detect anonymous function and to make give them a name
  8 */
  9 
 10 /**
 11  * @namespace
 12 */
 13 var debug	= {};
 14 
 15 Object.prototype.__defineQGetter__	|| require('./queueablegettersetter.js')
 16 
 17 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
 18 //		misc								//
 19 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
 20 
 21 /**
 22  * Display a message every time the function is called
 23  * 
 24  * @param {Function} fn the original function
 25  * @param {String} [message] message to display when the function is called. Optional
 26  * @returns {Function} The modified function
 27 */
 28 debug.obsolete	= function(originalFn, message){
 29 	return function(){
 30 		console.warn(message || "Obsoleted function called. Please update your code.");
 31 		console.trace();
 32 		// forward the call to the original function
 33 		return fn.apply(this, arguments);
 34 	}
 35 }
 36 
 37 /**
 38  * Wrap a function between 2 functions
 39  * 
 40  * @param {Function} originalFn the original function
 41  * @param {Function} beforeFn the function to call *before* the original function
 42  * @param {Function} afterFn the function to call *after* the original function
 43  * @returns {Function} The modified function
 44 */
 45 debug.wrapCall	= function(originalFn, beforeFn, afterFn){
 46 	return function(){
 47 		var stopNow	= false;
 48 		// call beforeFn if needed
 49 		if( beforeFn )	stopNow = beforeFn(originalFn, arguments);
 50 		// forward the call to the original function
 51 		var result	= originalFn.apply(this, arguments);
 52 		// call afterFn if needed
 53 		if( afterFn )	afterFn(originalFn, arguments, result);
 54 		// return the result
 55 		return result;
 56 	}
 57 }
 58 
 59 /**
 60  * Trigger the debugger when the function is called
 61  *
 62  * @param {Function} originalFn the original function
 63  * @param {Function} [conditionFn] this function should return true, when the breakpoint should be triggered. default to function(){ return true; }
 64  * @returns {Function} The modified function
 65 */
 66 debug.breakpoint	= function(fn, conditionFn){
 67 	conditionFn	= conditionFn	|| function(){ return true; };
 68 	return function(){
 69 		var stopNow	= conditionFn();
 70 		// if stopNow, trigger debugger
 71 		if( stopNow === true )	debugger;
 72 		// forward the call to the original function
 73 		return fn.apply(this, arguments);
 74 	}
 75 }
 76 
 77 /**
 78  * extract a stacktrace. TODO make it work in node.js/chrome/firefox and modern browsers
 79  * 
 80  * @param {Integer} [nShift] number of calls to skip in the stacktrace 
 81  * @returns {Array} array of object like {url: "http://*", line : 42, column: 12};
 82 */
 83 debug.stacktrace	= function(nShift){
 84 	var createException	= function() {
 85 		try{	this.undef();
 86 		}catch( e ){
 87 			return e;
 88 		}
 89 		return undefined;
 90 	};
 91 
 92 	var e		= createException();
 93 	var lines	= e.stack.split('\n');
 94 	var descLine	= lines.shift();
 95 	var locations	= [];
 96 	lines.forEach(function(line){
 97 		var matches	= line.match(/^\s+at\s+(.+):(\d+):(\d+)/);
 98 		console.assert(matches.length === 4, "Parse error in line: "+line)
 99 		locations.push({
100 			url	: matches[1],
101 			line	: parseInt(matches[2]),
102 			column	: parseInt(matches[3])
103 		});
104 	});
105 	// honor nShift
106 	nShift	= nShift !== undefined ? nShift : 0;
107 	for(var i = 0; i < nShift+2; i++)	locations.shift();
108 	// return the result
109 	return locations;
110 }
111 
112 /**
113  * assert which actually try to stop the excecution
114  * if debug.assert.useDebugger is falsy, throw an exception. else trigger the
115  * debugger. It default to false
116  *
117  * @param {Boolean} condition the condition which is asserted
118  * @param {String} message the message which is display is condition is falsy
119  * @param {Boolean} [useDebugger] the condition which is asserted
120 */
121 debug.assert	= function(condition, message, useDebugger){
122 	if( condition )	return;
123 	if( debug.assert.useDebugger || useDebugger )	debugger;
124 	throw new Error(message	|| "assert Failed")
125 }
126 debug.assert.useDebugger	= false;
127 
128 
129 /**
130  * Same as __LINE__ in C
131 */
132 debug.__defineQGetter__('__LINE__', function(){
133 	var stacktrace	= debug.stacktrace();
134 	return stacktrace[2].line
135 });
136 
137 /**
138  * Same as __LINE__ in C
139 */
140 debug.__defineQGetter__('__FILE__', function(){
141 	var stacktrace	= debug.stacktrace();
142 	var url		= stacktrace[2].url;
143 	var basename	= url.match(/([^/]*)$/)[1]	|| ".";
144 	//console.log("stacktrace", stacktrace, "url", url, "basename", basename)
145 	return basename;
146 });
147 
148 
149 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
150 //		Function Attribute						//
151 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
152 
153 /**
154  * Function attribute builder
155 */
156 debug.fnAttr	= function(originalFn){
157 	return new debug.FnAttrClass(originalFn)
158 }
159 
160 debug.FnAttrClass	= function(originalFn){
161 	this._currentFn	= originalFn;
162 }
163 
164 debug.FnAttrClass.prototype.done	= function(){
165 	return this._currentFn;
166 }
167 
168 debug.FnAttrClass.prototype.obsolete	= function(message){
169 	this._currentFn	= debug.wrapCall(this._currentFn, function(){
170 		console.warn(message || "Obsoleted function called. Please update your code.");
171 		console.trace();
172 	});
173 	return this;	// for chained API
174 }
175 
176 debug.FnAttrClass.prototype.timestamp	= function(){
177 	this._currentFn	= debug.wrapCall(this._currentFn, function(){
178 		console.log("run at "+ new Date);
179 	});
180 	return this;	// for chained API
181 };
182 
183 debug.FnAttrClass.prototype.log		= function(message){
184 	this._currentFn	= debug.wrapCall(this._currentFn, function(){
185 		console.log(new Date+" Function Enter."+message);
186 	}, function(){
187 		console.log(new Date+" Function Leave."+message);
188 	});
189 	return this;	// for chained API
190 };
191 
192 debug.FnAttrClass.prototype.warn	= function(message){
193 	this._currentFn	= debug.wrapCall(this._currentFn, function(){
194 		console.warn(new Date+" Function Enter."+message);
195 	}, function(){
196 		console.warn(new Date+" Function Leave."+message);
197 	});
198 	return this;	// for chained API
199 };
200 debug.FnAttrClass.prototype.error	= function(message){
201 	this._currentFn	= debug.wrapCall(this._currentFn, function(){
202 		console.error(new Date+" Function Enter."+message);
203 	}, function(){
204 		console.error(new Date+" Function Leave."+message);
205 	});
206 	return this;	// for chained API
207 };
208 debug.FnAttrClass.prototype.time	= function(label){
209 	label	= label !== undefined ? label : "fnAttr().time()-"+Math.floor(Math.random()*9999).toString(36);
210 	this._currentFn	= debug.wrapCall(this._currentFn, function(){
211 		console.time(label)
212 	}, function(){
213 		console.timeEnd(label)
214 	});
215 	return this;	// for chained API
216 };
217 debug.FnAttrClass.prototype.profile	= function(label){
218 	label	= label !== undefined ? label : "fnAttr().profile()-"+Math.floor(Math.random()*9999).toString(36);
219 	this._currentFn	= debug.wrapCall(this._currentFn, function(){
220 		console.profile(label)
221 	}, function(){
222 		console.profileEnd(label)
223 	});
224 	return this;	// for chained API
225 };
226 
227 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
228 //		type checking							//
229 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
230 
231 /**
232  * Ensure that the property is never NaN
233  * Inspired from http://29a.ch/2011/10/20/javascript-fuck-nan-undefined by @29a_ch
234  * 
235  * @param {Object} baseObject the base object containing the property
236  * @param {String} property the property to check
237 */
238 debug.noNaN	= function(baseObject, property){
239 	baseObject.__defineQSetter__(property, function(value){
240 		console.assert(value === value, "property '"+property+"' is a NaN");
241 		return value;
242 	});
243 }
244 
245 /**
246  * Ensure the type of a variable with typeof() operator
247  * 
248  * @param {Object} baseObject the base object containing the property
249  * @param {String} property the property to check
250  * @param {String} typeofString the exepected result of typeof(property)
251 */
252 debug.checkTypeof	= function(baseObject, property, typeofStr){
253 	baseObject.__defineQSetter__(property, function(value){
254 		debug.assert(typeof(value) === typeofStr, "property typeof('"+property+"') === '"+typeof(value)+"' (instead of '"+typeofStr+"')");
255 		return value;
256 	});
257 };
258 
259 /**
260  * Ensure the type of a variable with instanceof
261  * 
262  * @param {Object} baseObject the base object containing the property
263  * @param {String} property the property to check
264  * @param {Object} klass the expected class
265 */
266 debug.checkInstanceof	= function(baseObject, property, klass){
267 	baseObject.__defineQSetter__(property, function(value){
268 		// TODO add a link toward the origin error
269 		debug.assert(value instanceof klass, "property "+property+" not of proper class");
270 		return value;
271 	});
272 };
273 
274 /**
275  * Ensure the type of a variable using typeof or instanceof depending on klass
276  * 
277  * @param {Object} baseObject the base object containing the property
278  * @param {String} property the property to check
279  * @param {Object} klass the expected class
280 */
281 debug.checkType	= function(baseObject, property, klass){
282 	if( klass === Number ){
283 		debug.checkTypeof(baseObject, property, 'number');
284 	}else if( klass === String ){
285 		debug.checkTypeof(baseObject, property, 'string');
286 	}else{
287 		debug.checkInstanceof(baseObject, property, klass);		
288 	}
289 };
290 
291 /**
292  * Ensure the type of a variable with typeof() operator
293  * 
294  * @param {Object} baseObject the base object containing the property
295  * @param {String} property the property to check
296  * @param {function} callback the function called the property is set
297 */
298 debug.checkValueRange	= function(baseObject, property, callback){
299 	baseObject.__defineQSetter__(property, function(value){
300 		console.assert(callback(value) === true, "property '"+property+"' got invalid value. >"+value+"<");
301 		return value;
302 	});
303 };
304 
305 // export the namespace in node.js - if running in node.js
306 if( typeof(window) === 'undefined' )	module.exports	= debug;
